A4.text: For having proposed the green, white and red tricolour flag, Giuseppe Compagnoni is considered the 'father of the Italian flag'.

A6.text: The Italian tricolour was first adopted by an Italian state, the Cispadane Republic, during Napoleonic Italy, following the French Revolution.
